author: Megan Ellis
title: The cheapest cities...for beer!
text:
The cheapest cities...for beer! Wed, 01 Jul 2015 11:37 AM Share Your Email Credit: bogdanhoda/shutterstock.com 
Here is some essential information - the cheapest cities around the world for beer. Okay, not really - but it's still pretty useful. 
GoEuro, a bus, train and flight comparison site, released the results of its 2015 Beer Price Index . 
You'll be surprised which SA city ranked at number 12. 
The index used data from 75 cities around the world, calculating the price of the average beer. 
The beers included in the index are the most commonly imported beers in the countries as well as the main local beer. 
So where can you get beers for the cheapest? That will be Krakow (Poland) and Kiev (Ukraine), both with an average beer price of $1.66 (R20.18). 
However, the cheapest supermarket beer is found in Seville in Spain, with an average price of $0.52 (R6.32). 
Meanwhile, the cheapest beer at bars is found in Delhi in India, with an average of $2.31 (R28.09). 
Surprisingly, Cape Town, renowned for being no friend to your wallet, ranked at number 12 on the list. 
Cape Town's average beer price is $2.14 (R26.02). Johannesburg was not included on the index. 
So what are the top ten cheapest cities for beers?
